name: Bright Angel Lodge and Cabins

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Bright Angel Lodge and Cabins (in the Buckley lodge) for two nights. The accommodations in the room we stayed were very basic - no television or AC. We really didn't miss those items (after coming back from the day long mule trip resting on the bed was about the only thing we wanted to do!). The room was very clean although a little on the cramped side.
reviews.title: Nice Rustic accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 6 months in advance and still were not able to book a room with a direct view of the canyon. However, we were only a few feet away from the south rim so we really didn't feel like we missed out on anything.
reviews.title: Charming Cabins
Great experience
reviews.text: Overall, it was a great experience being so close to the canyon. While the accommodations at the lodge are not lavish by any means, staying at them allows you to see the sun rise and set over one of the most beautiful places on earth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bright Angel Cabins are quaint but comfortable historic cabins at the rim of the Grand Canyon. You may not have a view, but if you don't, it is a few steps away. Our room was clean and pleasant in every way, if not quite luxurious. The rustic feel is part of the charm. My only complaint is that they will not check you in before 4:00. If you are planning an overnight backpacking trip to the bottom of the canyon, and you expect to reach the rim well before 4:00, as we did, filthy and tired, you may want to book somewhere else where you can shower and rest earlier in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Rustic Place to Stay

likes.liked: — It's not far from a great view of the Grand Canyon
likes.disliked: — sharing a bathroom with the people in the next room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a 'hikers room' for what I consider to be a great rate. Room was basic (no a/c or television) but spotless. Did have a phone though which was nice for telephone calls home on the calling card. Washroom and showers down the halls were clean and never busy. Just steps from the rim, awesome.
reviews.title: fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Powell Lodge, which belongs to the Bright Angel Lodge and Cabins facilities. We had a cute and charming double room close to the rim. The room was in perfect condition and gave the right feeling for a Grand Canyon holiday. The value was excellent, and I would come back anytime. Probably the best stay on a 5 week trip.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at a lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed 2 nights in a partial view cabin. I still can't believe how spectacular the view was from this room and the closeness to the rim! The room itself was simple and comfortable with high beamed ceilings and stone covered walls. The windows all had screens as did the outside doors (there were 2 doors, one in front at the rim & a back door which housekeeping used to service the rooms). The bathroom was modern & spotless. Our room was at the end of the building and very quiet. We loved coming back throughout our stay to grab cold drinks from the refrigerator and sit relaxing by the window gazing out at the Grand Canyon!
reviews.title: Made for a Wonderful Memory!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had really expected that a trip to the canyon was going to be filled with tourists, especially in mid June, and there were certainly lots and lots, but staying at the Bright Angel Lodge gave the sense of being away from it all, sort of like camping in high style from another era! Everyone we encountered there gave us service with a smile and seemed happy to have us there. It was just a great experience all around!
reviews.title: definitely worthwhile

reviews.text: Bright Angel is a modest well priced lodge right on the South Rim. You can't get much closer! Sure it was a busy spot during the day what with all the tourists, but the lodge itself was quiet as most people are outside anyway. The room was clean, the shared shower was clean and we never had to wait for anyone else. The dinners we had in the restaurant were excellent value - fresh crisp veggies, etc. Friendly staff except one young woman at the front desk - she didn't look like she belonged at a rustic lodge either..... and it is unusual for us to make such a comment. She certainly made our entrance a questionable experience but everyone else erased her memory for the most part. Just try to look past all the people mingling around the Rim. We were amazed at the lack of judgement by some people heading down the trail totally unprepared for the heat and terrain. Most upsetting when you saw young children in tow without hats, food, water or proper footwear. Also, teenagers throwing stones and small rocks down over the edge, knowing there was a trail below with hikers on it - one woman voiced her concern rather nicely to a young man who was throwing rocks, his father certainly wasn't a positive role model for him and didn't see the concern. definitely excellent value for the money at this lodge if you are truly going for the natural experience and don't need television etc.
reviews.title: stay here for the location

reviews.text: We stayed in Buckey lodge (not the cabins) in a room with 2 double beds. The lodge and cabins are very different entities sitting side by side on the rim I think the building was constructed in the 30's so I understand some of the features.Remember, the rule of thumb - this is a national park lodge. Think "basic!"
reviews.title: Book a rim cabin 6 months to a year ahead and you will be so glad you did!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Bright Angel lodge in June for 3 days. We stayed in room 6146 which was right on the rim. The room was very nice , and had 2 chairs in it , which we turned around so they would face the canyon. The view was to die for. They had a ceiling fan over the bed which made the room very confortable. There was a tv but we never turned it on,as we enjoyed watching the sun go down and the changing views of the canyon.
reviews.title: Bright Angel Lodge was wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. On checkin the bellboy was busy so after a brief wait, they had a new desk enployee help with our luggage. They went the extra mile.
reviews.title: IT GETS VERY HOT IN THE ROOM. THE FAN DOESN'T REALLY HELP.
spectacular rim views
reviews.text: The food at both Bright Angel,and the Arizona room was very good and moderately priced. I hope to be able to go back again in the near future. The only negative is they could use additional parking.

We stayed in a room without facilities in Powell Lodge. The bed was a small queen and for 2 adults wasn't really big enough. We spent 2 sleepless nights there because of the small bed and the fact the there is no air conditioning. The noisy fan on the drawers didn't really do anything at all. The toilets and shower were alwalys clean and well maintained. The food at the restaurants was awful. Poor quality and overpriced. We ate out at a steakhouse the second night but although the food was good, the service was dreadful. The best thing is of course the location. Once the day trippers have gone you have the place to yourself - just about. Check in staff were adequate but not friendly. We spent most of our free time outside on the porch of El Tovar on their rocking chairs. Bliss.
reviews.title: Great Location - Good Value

reviews.text: We got a cosy little room (at Powell Lodge) overlooking the rim. Of course it gets (very) busy during the day, yet after 6 PM it's quiet and you can enjoy the most spectacular rim views and take breathtaking walks enjoying the magnificence of the canyon. Great value for money. Book early in advance though, otherwise you'll have to spend twice as much - like we did on our second night - for a place half as nice in Tusayan or further down the road.
reviews.title: Rim Cabins - Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in a partial view cabin and we're very impressed. The room was more modern than I had expected (TV, fridge, new bathroom)... We had a roll-away bed - works fine for the third person (teen), but made the room a little crowded. BUT.. the view made up for that! We felt like we were part of the Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: This is the place to experience the Grand Canyon!

reviews.text: The weekend was HOT, but the overhead fan and windows open kept us cool. Didn't find it at all noisy, even during the day when the crowds were there. Bright Angel restaurant was great for breakfast, and the ice cream was a welcome afternoon treat. HINT: both nights for dinner we went to El Tovar for appetizers/wine on their outside patio/porch and watched the sun set! Walked back to our cabin (in the dark) spotting elk and deer along the way.
reviews.title: Comfy cabin just a stone's throw from the rim

reviews.text: Check-in and parking were easy and staff was friendly. Lots of info for hikes during the day, and the shuttle system really works. Can't imagine seeing the Grand Canyon any other way!!
reviews.title: Back to Nature

reviews.text: Remember to book early! I booked 1 year in advance and it was worth it!!
reviews.title: Excellent right on Rim

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in the historic cabin suite. Two adults, two teenagers. Walk out the back door, go 150 feet, you're at the edge of the south rim and the Bright Angel trail head! How can you beat that? Two room suite had a nice sitting room with comfortable furniture, TV, refrigerator, coffee maker. Bedroom had two queen beds. Suite allowed kids and us to have some welcomed extra space. No A/C, but ceiling fans in each room kept it comfortable. Bathroom clean and modern. Dutch doors in front and back of cabin were a neat touch. Had a minor maintenance issue, but was impressed by how quickly the hotel staff responded to & resolved it. Just a short walk to the Bright Angel Restaurant, which served good breakfasts & dinners -- not cheap, but not overpriced either. Staying right on the rim gives you the opportunity to explore it in the early morning and late evening, when there are no crowds -- very neat. The stone corral, where mule trips into the canyon originate, was just a short walk from our cabin. Was fun to walk down each morning to watch wide-eyed folks saddle up and head over the edge. We took the overnight mule trip to the bottom of the canyon & Phantom Ranch. Truly the experience of a lifetime. Was worth every penny and then some. Even our teenagers, as hard as they tried, could not hide the fact that they were having the time of their lives. Very amusing & satisfying to observe! If you're planning to ride the mules, reserve well ahead to avoid disappointment. We booked nearly a year in advance.
reviews.title: What a View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in historic cabin #6167 at Bright Angel Lodge for $106 per night. I was a little worried about how “historic” the cabin would be, but my husband and I were pleasantly surprised! It seems that the cabins have been recently remodeled. Although the construction is old wood, everything seems to have a new coat of paint, and the bathroom has been completely updated. There is a queen bed, a desk, chair, an armoire, cable TV, a small refrigerator, coffeemaker, and a hair dryer.
reviews.title: Charming cabins!

reviews.text: We reserved a cabin that I understood to be a row behind the cabins with Rim views. However we were thrilled that because of the location of the parking lot, we could see the Rim from our front door as well, although we were a little further back (and away from the crowded Rim Trail!)
reviews.title: Brilliant value for money

likes.disliked: — No contingency to feed guests during power outage

reviews.text: Because there is no air conditioning and we went to bed early to prepare for an early morning hike, it was still hot when we went to bed, but it cooled off through the night, and by and large we were quite comfortable.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: The one thing I wish I had known when we arrived is that there is a small parking lot for hotel guests around the cabin area. We dragged our suitcases from far away, up a hill, and over train tracks when we checked in, when we could have parked right outside our cabin door.
reviews.title: Living History!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When making reservations, I had a tough time choosing between the Yavapai Lodge and the Bright Angel cabins, but after being there, I’m really glad we chose the cabins. They are really cute and right near the action—just a stone’s throw away from the Rim Trail and the Bright Angel Trail.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the north rim a few years ago we weren't expecting much from our historic cabin but we were pleasantly surprised. The cabin was bright, with a nice fan, windows that opened and the best part...an updated and spacious bathroom. Bed was comfortable, pillows a disappointment...foam. Bell service was great, as we had come up on the train, and our bags were in our room, and next day the bellman took care of returning them to the train station. Overall we liked this room better than the Zane Grey suite at the El Tover, where we stayed several years ago.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took our in room coffee to a bench out on the rim for a pleasant sunrise, although the sunrise isn't much from this area.
reviews.title: good place

reviews.text: Nice place.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large, clean and confortable room but not too much silent.
reviews.title: Good value for such a wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and value. Stayed at the Buckey Lodge for 1 night in August. Spent $96 for our own shower. Spent most of the day on the Bright Angel Trail with the family. Weather was cool and packed a lunch for the trail. Spent the 2nd night in Williams for half the cost through priceline. The only downside is that you have to stalk the lot for pking space. This is the best value in the park.
reviews.title: A gem on the edge.

reviews.text: We stayed at Bright Angel Cabins. Cabins were comfy and clean. Make sure you specify rim view when booking because you will get a standard rim cabin without a view. Rim view cabins are booked first so don't be disappointed if you do not get a view. These cabins are located close to the Hermits rest bus stop. Staying inside the Grand Canyon is well worth it. We had a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Cabins are Nice

likes.disliked: — built on a cesspool outside door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 Nights in May and while the room was a bit small the location was so great that u forget about the room as soon as u make a step out. We had no AC no TV and a very small bed but it was a half minute walk to the South Rim. Perfect.
reviews.title: Wild Wild West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really felt like we were timetravelled to the past.
reviews.title: nice rustic feel

likes.disliked: — thin wall could hear the neighbors

reviews.text: Check In was nice and quick and they had the room ready nearly two hours before regular check in time.
reviews.title: Western Beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there in May. It was a bit chilly as we were there when a cold front came thru. The location on the Grand Canyon is wonderful. We stayed in one of the cabins. It was just a short walk to the rim. There were I think 3 rooms in the cabin building. The walls must of been very thin as we could hear our neighbors loud every morning. The good thing about the cabins compared to staying at the lodge was that you had your own small bathroom. Granted it was small, but it was as much room as you needed. The beds say they are queens, but they are really full size. The experience was nice. Don't think you are going to have a normal hotel experience stay as you are at a national park. It is more of a camping like feeling/ Parking can be hard to come by we lucked out and got a spot right outside our cabin. it is a very very busy place as it is in the village loop area. I would recommend this to anyone who might be visiting, just want to let you know it is nothing fancy.
reviews.title: Loved the view at Bright Angel Lodge

likes.liked: — There is no other accomadation closer to the rim

reviews.text: Just returned from a glorious night at Bright Angel Lodge. I had reservations at a hotel in Flagstaff, but wanted to be closer to the canyon. So, I called the property the day before our arrival and lucked into a rim cabin with a view!!
reviews.title: Pure Delight!

reviews.text: It could not have been nicer. It was clean and well-appointed, and we could not have asked for anything more! The canyon view out our window was incredibly awe-inspiring! While true that the pathway and benches were directly outside about 10 yards away, we were not bothered by noise. It offered a fun people-watching opportunity as humanity in all sizes, shapes, and nationalities paraded by. After dark and before dawn, a reverent silence prevailed; and people seemed to talk in quiet whispers if at all.
reviews.title: awesome south rim experience

reviews.text: This property is conveniently located to the rim trail and we walked for miles savoring the incredible view. We highly recommend this property. Go! Hurry up!
reviews.title: All You Could Want in a Grand Canyon Experience

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Bright Angel, my wife and I with teen son in a rim cabin and our adult children with spouses in two lodge rooms. We loved the cabin. It has only a double bed but rollaways are available for $10/night. You could walk right out the back door to the edge of the south rim. The motel rooms were practically adjacent to our cabin, making it a convenient location to meet up. The staff was very courteous and helpful and housekeeping was more than adequate. We didn't expect five star digs on the rim of the canyon. This was our third trip here - the first time we stayed in Tusayan (an option only if you can't get in the park), the second in the Maswik Lodge (adequate, a short walk from the rim) and this time was the best.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to score walk-up reservations for Bright Angel Cabins during the summer. The gas crisis has helped availability quite a bit. Anyway, the cabin was clean, had great parking immediately next to the cabin, a small fridge, and clean bed and bathroom. We paid about ninety bucks for a double bed, but it was quite worth it.
reviews.title: great

aka: Bright Angel Lodge And Cabins Hotel
